message.body: My results!
Ahahah
23andMe's sample population for Italian is mostly Southern Italians in the U.S. That's why I clustered so much with them.
Basically the "Italian" includes Arab and Greek/Balkan DNA.
They say to read it like. "9.1% more Middle Eastern & North Agra than the average Southern Italian."
Right... and when Steph washes up for me to show her, she is going to look at african and say "see! You are black"
My AncestryDNA didn't show West African but 23andme is 90% confident that I have 0.1%
Mom has 0.3%
and she has 12.0% MENA
But we are definitely dominant Italian?
Definitely yeah. But I don't know how much.
Southern Italians are different from Northern Italians because they are mixed indigenous Italian, Greek, and MENA.
Right.... You're over moms?
So when it says 74.9% Italian it actually means 74.9% of this Southern Italian mix
And we don't have northern Italian?
Italian includes Northern Italian too, but just not as much. Maybe 50 out of 700 people.
Also, once I get dad's and grandma's results, I'm gonna link everyone's and they will all update.
Oh right yea I was going to ask if you had theirs yet but asked if you were at noms instead bec I would have just met up with you
Are you going there?
I want but now im going to pick mom up abd drop ger off at the Phillies stadium. She has work until 4
I wanted to say. I don't know when you plan on doing it, but when you do, you should see who else wants it. Robert and Victor were talkng about it. You get 20% off each additional one.
Ah ok
